Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2008 08:09PM cneal318 wrote: Thanks Everyone for your helpful suggestions, kind words and prayers. Mom finished her radiation today and she is exhausted. Her throat has been sore. The rads onc checked it out and said she had thrush from the steroid and gave her an antibiotic. He said that they would rescan her brain in 3 months. We are tappering her off the steroid slowly. I really hope this takes care of the brain mets. We go for chemo the end of this month and the onc has decided to keep her on the same chemo since they dont think that the chemo was giving her the problems. I am very happy about this because this chemo has been working for her. I am so blessed to have all of you around me! Hugs to All Crystal

Posts.Title: MOM NOW HAS BRAIN METS! cneal318 TripleNeg

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 05:01PM cneal318 wrote: Hello Everyone, Thanks for all the suggestions and support. We are back from seeing the radiation onc and he was wonderful. Mom was marked today and will start radiation tomorrow for 10 days also mom was put on a steriod and has to take it 4 times a day while going through the radiation. He told her not to be surprised if she has a sudden burst of energy. He also told us to get an antacid over the counter for her to take each day as the steroid will cause some upset of the stomach. He told us many of things you all have said. Stephanie, this will be the 4th time mom has lost her hair and now she says its the least of her worries for now, and she has never once shaved it off. Mom also has anti nausea medication already. He also told that she will be very tired after starting the radiation. I will keep you posted on how things are going. Stephanie I will probably have many questions for you along the way. I thank all of you for you prayers, support and suggestions. Hugs Crystal
Posts.Title: MOM NOW HAS BRAIN METS! cneal318 TripleNeg

Posts.Title: MOM NOW HAS BRAIN METS! cneal318 TripleNeg

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2008 04:45PM cneal318 wrote: Hello All, Today was day three of brain radiation and mom is doing ok. Saturday night at about 11:00 pm I received a call from my mom and all she was doing was moaning on the phone so I was asking her what was wrong and all she could do was moan. So I went over there immediatly and she said she had the worst headache ever and her stomach was hurting. Did anyone experience anything like this with there wbr. I ended up spending the night with her. We were up a few more times in the night also. I noticed today as well she would say something and then repeat the same thing again a few minutes later. I didnt seem to notice this in her before. Hugs Crystal
Posts.Title: MOM NOW HAS BRAIN METS! cneal318 TripleNeg

Posts.Content: cneal318 wrote: Hello Everyone, Mom had brain scan today at 9:15am,We got back to her house at 11:00am and the phone was ringing. It was the nurse from the oncologist office, they had the results from scan that quickly and mom now has brain mets on the left side of the brain, they are scattered and very small. We see the radiation oncologist tomorrow for her to be marked and radiation will start the day after. The nurse says they will probably do whole brain radiation, nurse seems to think for 10 days to start. What can mom expect as far as side effects go. Mom has liver mets and bone mets as well. Now this! Can brains mets be treated for a long time. Any help or suggestions would be great! Crystal Hugs Crystal Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: cneal318 wrote: First I would like to say that I draw so much strength from all you and the advise you give. For those of you who dont know me, I post for my mother who was diagnosed with stage 4 breast cancer in December 2005 with mets to liver and bone. She is er-,pr- and her 2+++. She has been recieving carboplatin, avastin, and she also takes tykerb and she gets zometa for bones. Last week at her chemo appointment she started to feel very sick and starting vomiting and she said it felt like her throat was closing up, she had received everything but the carbo before getting sick, so they didnt give it to her. Instead her onc wanted us to come back on Monday of this week for them to try a small dose of the carbo to see if they same think happened again. Well we went back and she recieved the chemo and after receiving almost all of it, she started to feel sick again and stated her throat felt like it was closing up again. Well needless to say onc said no more of that chemo for her. I am so upset because she has been doing very well on this chemo till now. Has anyone else ever experienced this. I feel like we are going through chemo options to fast and soon there will be nothing else to try. She is only 55 and I want her here for many more years. I had to call the onc today because said that she wants a break from the chemo. So I talked with onc and she said she would let her skip her next treatment which is second week of October and come in for the next treat after that which is at the end of October. That will give her about a month off. I am really scared that alot can happen in that month, but my mother wants this. I feel like I am loosing hope because it seems to be one thing after another. Thanks in advance for letting me ramble. Hugs Crystal Hugs Crystal Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2008 02:18AM - edited Mar 2, 2008 02:19AM by cneal318 Kasey, I have been researching this same chemo for my mom. Mom is still currently on Tykerb and Xeloda. However she may switched to this after we see lab work on March 19. I will keep you posted. This is a section from an article on the drug that mentions some of the side effects. I hope it helps. The downside of Ixempra is that chemo that goes after dividing cells, also attacks healthy cells along with cancerous ones. Ixempra's side effects include fatigue, hair loss and anorexia. Patients may experience a decrease in red blood cells, muscle pain, joint pain, the feeling of pins and needles in their fingers and toes, and in severe cases, inability to use their hands and feet fully. Does Taxol sound familiar? Crystal

Posts.Content: cneal318 wrote: Hello Everyone,  For those who not familiar with my moms dx. Mom was dx in December 2005 with stage 4 bc ibc with mets to liver and in April 2007 mets to bone. We have no family history and before this mom was the picture of health no major health problems. She is also er-,pr- and her2+++. Well I wanted to update everyone on my mom. We went to onc on Wednesday and blood work shows that the xeloda is not working. So she will have to be put on yet another chemo. The onc is putting her on carboplatin every three weeks in addition to her zometa infusions and she will continue to take the tykerb also. She will start the new chemo Monday March 24. Mom didnt take the news to well, she feels like we are going through the different chemos to quickly and that we will run out of options soon. Her liver enzymes are up also. Is there anyone here who has been on this chemo. I welcome any information you can give on it. I have done some research on it and it says she will loose her hair (this will be the 3rd time). I truley hate this disease! I know it is going to take my mom away from me much sooner that she needs to be taken. She is 55 and still has so much more to offer to the world. It seems like we keep getting nothing but bad news. Oh also she had scans yesterday so we will find out the results next week on those. Im sorry to ramble on but I am so down right now. I just want to cry. Hugs Crystal[Edit] [Delete] Hugs Crystal Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: cneal318 wrote: Hello Everyone, I have not posted lately due to mom being in the hospital for almost a month. Mom has been really out of lately, so the doctor ordered some additional blood work to be done. I received a call from the oncologist today stating that her liver is failing and told us she hopes mom makes it to christmas for us but doesnt expect her to make beyond a few weeks. We meet with hospice tomorrow. I am so upset right now although I new her time was coming sooner than later I did not expect to here less than a few weeks. Please keep me and my family in your prayers.  Crystal Hugs Crystal Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2008 04:16AM cneal318 wrote: Thank you all for your kind words, mom continues to go downhill, she is not talking much at all right now and is not eating. The hospice nurses are wonderful. They have given me so much comfort and peace with the way they are taking care of her. My grandmother who is here from Alabama is taking this very hard. She has to watch her oldest child at the age of 55 slowly pass away. She told me this is so very hard because as a mother you don't expect to loose your child before you go. I am trying to be strong for everyone but it is becoming more difficult each day. Thanks again to all of you for your continued prayers and thoughts. Crystal
